source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Salvia
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria Vol. 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1999). Salvia. In: Walsh, N.G, Entwisle, T.J., Flora of Victoria Vol. 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae, pp. 428-430. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Branches glabrous or with simple, mostly antrorse hairs only; corolla c. 5 mm long, with abaxial lip up to twice as long as adaxial lip
Branches with stalked glandular hairs and simple hairs; corolla c. 10 mm long, with abaxial at least twice as long as adaxial lip
